text: As thunder roars, so the charge advances like the wind.
Temporarily retreat to conserve strength and bide your time.
Easier to move mountains than to break this army's resolve.
[[col:red]]Cannot fire while the formation is active.[[/col]]  \\n\\nWhere the shield wall stands, there is no retreat.
[[col:red]]Formation cannot be maintained when unit size is too low.[[/col]]  \\n\\nA well-ordered shield wall, as mighty as the Great Bastion, supports the backbone of the Cathayan empire.
The sight of the Beiwei Army charging into battle inspires the entire force to fight with unparalleled bravery.
Like a rolling boulder smashing through the enemy or an immovable mountain holding the line, their duty is unyielding.

These enchanted roars from the guardian stone lions will destabilize the corporeal form of Chaos Daemons, [[col:red]][[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/daemonic.png]][[/img]]removing their Daemonic attribute[[/col]].
When the battle turns in their favor, the Jade Lion riders channel the winds of magic across the battlefield.
Warriors charging alongside the Jade Lions feel an overwhelming surge of magical empowerment.
This heavy cavalry unit possesses collision attack capabilities.
This unit is deeply influenced by Cathayan military strategy, embracing martial harmony while growing distant from their original specialties.
These burly ogres at least know to climb the walls and wreak havoc, rather than ramming their clubs straight into stone.
